intro: Theodorea triangulata, commonly known as the triangular theodorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
